page.title: 03The village school
page.content:
Draycott in the Clay has a coeducational Church of England controlled first school with 58 pupils. The childrens' ages range from 4 to 9 and they are divided into 3 classes. Most of the children live in Draycott but a minibus brings 8 children from Marchington Woodlands and isolated houses en route.
The school was opened on April 26th 1966; it replaced the former school which is now used as the village hall. It is set in farmland and has views across open country towards Hanbury.
The school is very well thought of by the local villagers and is enthusiastically supported in all its activities.
